result.execSummary:
The defendant Jake K. Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(>3-10g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Good faith effort to obtain and maintain fulltime employment and/or school and if not 10 hours Community Service.

Counseling.
DNA Sample & Surcharge.
Eligible for CIP and SAP.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jake K. Jones

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of Plea and Sentencing hearing on 10/29/2014 - includes 12CF155 & 14CF613
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment

Case called: 9:36am. Clerk: Denise. INCLUDES 12CF155, 14CF613. State appears by ADA Kerri Puig. Defendant appears in custody and by Atty Zachary Glascock. Matter set for SAR in 12CF155 & Plea in 14CF613. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to delete enhancers in ct 1 14CF613 - crt grants. PLEA: NO CONTEST - amend ct 1 (poss w/intent-amp (>3-10g) 14CF613. Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  Atty Glascock makes statement. Defendant makes statement.
COURT ORDERS: 14CF613 - WI State Prison Total of 8 1/2 yrs; Initial Confinement 3 1/2 yrs; Extended Supervision 5 yrs.  
Credit of 109 days credit. Conditions of ES: Counseling; Good faith effort to obtain and maintain fulltime employment and/or school and if not 10 hrs Community Service; Court Costs; DNA Sample & Surcharge
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Substance Abuse Program. Crt informs and defendant signs Ineligible Voting Form. 
COURT ORDERS: 12CF155 - WI State Prison Total of 7yrs; Initial Confinement 3 yrs; Extended Supervision 4 yrs.
Credit of 247 days credit. 
Conditions of ES: Counseling; Good faith effort to obtain and maintain fulltime employment and/or school and if not 10 hrs Community Service; Court Costs.
Eligible or not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Substance Abuse Program. Copy of CR 234 given to defendant after Court. Adjourned: 9:49am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
